Author: bls
Content: Comodo and other SSL providers will give you free certs that don't cause any warnings. But, they only last 3 months instead of 1 year.

Author: menloparkbum
Content: the job ad says they are looking for someone to develop fraud-detection algorithms. the poisson distribution is not esoteric in that context.

Author: davidw
Content:
Precisely - the difference is between "worthless", which we instinctively know isn't true, and "won't pay money for":

http://journal.dedasys.com/articles/2007/04/26/ideas-are-worthless

In short: for practical purposes, PG is right, but wrong in his theory.

Author: RyanGWU82
Content:
For me it's Scholastic News and Nick.com.

(In other words: shouldn't this depend on your product and your target market?!? Or is everyone just building generic Web 2.0 apps that only appeal to alpha geeks?)

Author: davidw
Content:
This has been around before, there were some listed here:

http://news.ycombinator.com/comments?id=16901

Personally, I find the "big, but not huge" ones the most inspirational for some reason. Larry Ellison, Bill Gates, Steve Jobs and the like have been covered a lot in various ways, and have also had time to let their legends grow in their own minds.

Author: staunch
Content:
++++ Brad Fitzpatrick / LiveJournal

++++ Joe Kraus / JotSpot (not Excite)

+++ Chad Hurley or Steve Chen / YouTube

+++ Reid Hoffman / LinkedIn

+++ Jason Calacanis / Weblogsinc

++ Markus Frind / PlentyOfFish

++ Kevin Rose / Digg

++ Mark Zuckerberg / Facebook

+ Michael Arrington / TechCrunch

Author: zach
Content:
Good suggestions. Haven't we all had enough of Molyneux, though? Plus, who out there is starting a game company? Nobody. Maybe Nolan Bushnell would be interesting, though.

I have a few suggestions of my own:

- Jeremy Wertheimer (ITA)

- Justin Frankel (Nullsoft)

- Lars Rasmussen (Where2)

- Jawed Karim (YouTube)

- Wil Shipley (Delicious Monster)

Longshots: Bill Joy, Larry or Sergey, Marc Andreessen, Pierre Omidyar
